did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Two timetables of the Wabash Railway, serving the upper mid-central United States.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Wabash Railway Timetables must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Wabash Railway Timetables, Ms2010-071, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Wabash Railway Timetables were donated to Special Collections in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Wabash Railway Timetables commenced and was completed in October 2010.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Wabash Railway Company was formed in 1915 through a reorganization of the Wabash Railroad Company, itself a product of an 1889 reorganization of predecessor lines. The railroad served the upper mid-central United States, with primary connections in Kansas City, St. Louis, Chicago, Detroit, Toledo and Buffalo. In 1942, the company's name reverted to the Wabash Railroad Company. In 1960, the line was leased by the Norfolk & Wetern Railway and eventually purchased by Norfolk Southern in 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two timetables issued by the Wabash Railway in the 1930s. In addition to lists of stations, routes, arrival and departure times, the timetables include names of officials, system maps, and advertising matter.
